alert.note: Alert for Northeast Mountains; Spokane Area (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued January 16 at 8:41PM PST until January 18 at 4:00AM PST by NWS Spokane
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM MIDNIGHT TONIGHT TO 4 AM PST THURSDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow expected. Total snow accumulations between 6 to 12 inches in the valleys and 12 to 18 inches in the mountains. * WHERE...Downtown Spokane, Athol, Bonners Ferry, Orin-Rice Road, Metaline Falls, Clark Fork, Newport, Schweitzer Mountain Road, Worley, Post Falls, Moscow, Chewelah, Deer Park, Rockford, Spokane Valley, Flowery Trail Road, Kettle Falls, Fruitland, Springdale-Hunters Road, Plummer, Colville, Ione, Tiger, Genesee, Potlatch, Airway Heights, Northport, Coeur d`Alene, Cheney, Davenport, Metaline, Fairfield, Priest River, Eastport, Sandpoint, and Hayden. * WHEN...From midnight tonight to 4 AM PST Thursday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. The hazardous conditions could impact the Wednesday morning and evening commutes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Heaviest snow rates of between 0.5 and 1 inch per hour will occur early Wednesday morning into the morning commute period and then again Wednesday afternoon into the evening commute period. Snow rates will be closer to the 1 inch per hour during the Wednesday evening commute.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. In Idaho, for the latest road information in Idaho, call 5 1 1. In Washington, for the latest travel information in Washington, go to https://wsdot.wa.gov/travel
